Uses of Class
org.openliberty.openaz.azapi.pep.PepException

Packages that use PepException
org.openliberty.openaz.azapi.pep The goal of this package is to simplify the creation of Policy Enforcement Points or peps built on top of the azapi package (note that where the class descriptions below are blank, that generally means that the class is primarily used for lower layer non-application facing operations). 
 

Uses of PepException in org.openliberty.openaz.azapi.pep
 

Methods in org.openliberty.openaz.azapi.pep that throw PepException
 boolean PepResponse.allowed()
          Returns the decision associated with the current result.
 PepResponse PepRequest.decide()
          Calls the AzService for a decision and returns the information to the caller in the form of a PepResponse
 PepResponse DecisionHandler.decide(PepRequest request)
          Returns a PepResponse containing either a single or multiple decisions based on the PepRequestOperation that was used to create the PepRequest by the PepRequestFactory
 java.lang.Object PepResponse.getAction()
          Return the action object associated with the current result.
 AzResponseContext PepResponse.getAzResponseContext()
          The handle to the actual AzResponseContext, which may be used with the interfaces provided in the org.openliberty.openaz.azapi package.
 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Obligation> PepResponse.getObligations()
          Return the set of Obligations associated with the current result indexed by ObligationId.
 java.lang.Object PepResponse.getResource()
          Return the resource object associated with the current result.

          Create a PepRequest using objects
 PepRequest PepRequestFactory.newPepRequest(java.lang.String subjectName, java.lang.String actionId, java.lang.String resourceId)
          Create a PepRequest just using Strings
 PepRequest PepRequestFactory.newQueryPepRequest(java.lang.Object subjectObj, java.lang.Object environmentObj, java.lang.String scope, PepRequestQueryType queryType)
          Create a PepRequest using subject and environment objects, plus a "scope" String that represents a PDP policy-specific resource representation.
 boolean PepResponse.next()
          For bulk requests and query requests, move the internal iterator to the next result.
 void PostDecisionHandler.postDecide(PepRequest request, PepResponse response)
          This method is used to apply post-decision custom processing to the PepResponse after it has been returned from the PepRequest.decide() method.
 void PreDecisionHandler.preDecide(PepRequest request)
          This method is used to apply preliminary custom processing to the PepRequest prior to its being submitted with the PepRequest.decide() method.
 void PepRequest.setAccessSubject(java.lang.Object subjectObject)
          Sets the Subject based on the mapping of the native Java object passed containing Subject information.
 void PepRequest.setBulkResourceActions(java.util.List resourceObjects, java.util.List actionObjects)
          Set multiple resource and action pairs for this request using a list of actions and a list of resources, where both lists must be of equal length.
 void PepRequest.setEnvironment(java.lang.Object envObject)
          Sets the Environment based on the mapping of the native Java object passed containing the Environment information.
 void PepRequest.setResourceAction(java.lang.Object resource, java.lang.Object action)
          Set the resource and action for this PepRequest.
